purpose: To outline the approach and questions for conducting investor interviews.
title: Investor interviews will aim at teasing out investment theses and recognizing important patterns
reasoning_strategy: Provide a structured plan for conducting interviews and sample questions to guide discussions.

content: Conduct fifteen to twenty anonymous interviews
15-20 buy-side investors
~5 sell-side analysts
Best efforts on 2-3 “past investors” and 2-3 “potential investors”
Interviews are 30 - 45 minutes in duration
Client identifies 20-25 investors and 6-7 analysts (typical acceptance rate is 70%)
Client invites each of the potential participants individually via email or phone- possibly using script provided by BCG
Client will let BCG know when investors/analysts respond “yes” or “no”. BCG will then reach out to “yes” participants to schedule interviews and begin executing interviews
BCG conducts interviews and synthesizes findings to be shared with Client executives
Only IR-experienced Partners conduct interviews
Tailored interview guide that reflects the learnings from each interview and goes deep into the “why”
Tell me about how you invest stylistically?
How did you get from the universe of stocks to this sector, this name
What role does Client play in your portfolio (e.g., alpha, beta)?
Tell me about your thesis: Profit growth, valuation, cashflow; What do they add up to
Tell me about how you think about valuation. How should Client’s valuation evolve in that context?
Tell me about how and where you see Client as strategically advantaged/disadvantaged?
What are the most important 3-5 business agenda items for Client?
How should Client use its cash over the next 1-3 years? M&A, debt retirement, dividends, share repurchase, other?
What 1-2 sentences would you use to describe Client to a colleague who does not follow them?
